ender","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"recipient","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"params":{"_amountBeforeFee":"The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied."},"return":"_amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive."}},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minEclToReceive":"The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive."}},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation to prevent roundingerrors from removing more of the asset from the liquidity pool than intended.","params":{"_aBalance":"The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.","_aSent":"The quantity of asset A sent by the user to the liquidity pool.","_bBalance":"The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool."},"return":"_bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied."},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_ethBalanceOfDaiPool":"The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.","_ethBalanceOfEclPool":"The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.","_ethSent":"The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function."},"return":"_ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_daiSold":"The amount of DAI the user is selling.","_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","_minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."}},"title":"The Eclipseum ERC20 Smart Contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool."},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool."},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm."},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function."},"circulatingSupply()":{"notice":"Returns the circulating supply of ECL."},"constructor":"The constructor must be called with at least 0.2 ETH.","daiBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool."},"eclBalanceOfEclPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool."},"ethBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool."},"launch()":{"notice":"This function is called once to launch the contract."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool."},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool."},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity params._amountBeforeFee: The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied.

applyTransactionFee(uint256).return: _amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minEclToReceive: The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation to prevent roundingerrors from removing more of the asset from the liquidity pool than intended.

params._aBalance: The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.
params._aSent: The quantity of asset A sent by the user to the liquidity pool.
params._bBalance: The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).return: _bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied.

params._ethBalanceOfDaiPool: The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.
params._ethBalanceOfEclPool: The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.
params._ethSent: The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function.

calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256.return: _ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params._daiSold: The amount of DAI the user is selling.
params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params._minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

applyTransactionFee(uint256).notice: Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied.

buyDai(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool.

buyEcl(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm.

calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256.notice: Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function.

circulatingSupply().notice: Returns the circulating supply of ECL.

methods.constructor: The constructor must be called with at least 0.2 ETH.

daiBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool.

eclBalanceOfEclPool().notice: Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool.

ethBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool.

launch().notice: This function is called once to launch the contract.

sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool.

sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool.

softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity pool.
